Lindsay Kay

Portfolio

I've worked remotely with clients in the USA, Netherlands, France, Sweden and New Zealand, developing WebGL-based solutions for MedViz, BIM and CAD.

Summarized below are some of those projects and the open source libraries I created to support them.

March 28, 2018

The BioDigital Human™

The BioDigital Human is the leading Web-based 3D platform for the exploration of anatomy, medical conditions and treatments.

I worked remotely with BioDigital Systems in NYC as lead developer on the Human's WebGL-based 3D engine and developer API.

#JavaScript, #WebGL, #SceneJS

[ READ MORE >> ]

March 27, 2018

xeogl - a 3D library for WebGL-based ArchViz & CAD

xeogl is an open source (MIT) JavaScript library I created for WebGL-based 3D visualization in the browser.

xeogl is production-proven and currently used within several commercial BIM and CAD viewers.

#JavaScript, #WebGL, #glTF, #Opensource

[ VISIT WEBSITE >> ]

March 27, 2018

SceneJS - a 3D library for WebGL-based MedViz

SceneJS is an open source (MIT) JavaScript library I created for WebGL-based 3D visualization in the browser.

A modified, private fork of SceneJS powers the BioDigital Human, the leading online 3D platform for the exploration of anatomy, medical conditions and treatments.

#JavaScript, #WebGL, #Opensource

[ VISIT WEBSITE >> ]

March 26, 2018

BIMData™ WebGL-Based 3D BIM Viewer

BIMData is a cutting-edge platform to manage your construction projects, providing an all-in-one solution to visualize, check, edit and share building information.

I worked remotely with developers in Nice, France, to develop this viewer on xeogl, an open source library I created for 3D visualization in the browser.

#JavaScript, #WebGL, #glTF, #xeogl

[ VISIT WEBSITE >> ]

March 25, 2018

BIMSurfer WebGL-Based 3D BIM Viewer

BIMSurfer is the first open source WebGL-based IFC viewer, running as a Web client for BIMServer.

I work remotely with the team in the Netherlands to develop this viewer on xeogl, an open source library I created for 3D visualization in the browser.

#JavaScript, #WebGL, #xeogl, #Opensource

[ VISIT WEBSITE >> ]

February 27, 2018

SolidComponents™ WebGL-Based 3D CAD Viewer

SolidComponents™ provides an online 3D catalog that allows buyers to preview product designs published directly from SolidWorks.

I worked remotely with engineers in Halmstad, Sweden to develop their WebGL-based CAD viewer on xeogl, an open source library I created for 3D visualization in the browser.

#JavaScript, #WebGL, #3DXML, #xeogl

[ VISIT WEBSITE >> ]

February 16, 2018

xeometry - a WebGL-based 3D model viewing library

xeometry is an experimental open source JavaScript library I created for viewing and interacting with 3D glTF models on WebGL.

Use xeometry to rapidly build 3D viewer apps and interactive presentations, or as a boilerplate on which to base your own 3D viewer.

#JavaScript, #WebGL, #glTF, #xeogl, #Opensource

[ VISIT WEBSITE >> ]

February 16, 2018

Creating WebGL Demos for zSpace using xeogl

zSpace is a technology firm based in Sunnyvale, California that combines elements of VR and AR in a specially-built computer system.

In 2017, I partnered with zSpace to develop WebGL-based demos on the zSpace 300 system using xeogl, an open source library I created for 3D visualization in the browser.

#WebGL, #WebVR, #xeogl

[ READ MORE >> ]

February 16, 2018

Testing Wind Turbines for Windflow™

Windflow Technology Ltd is a wind turbine design and manufacturing company that provides an innovative two-bladed design that copes with strong, turbulent and high-shear winds.

I contracted with electrical and mechanical engineers at Holmes Consulting in New Zealand to analyze terrabyte-sized datasets to verify the turbines' power efficiency and structural performance.

#PostgreSQL, #Java
